data.title: Is there a shortcut to collapse all multiline comments?
data.body:
I like to leave detailed comments of wth is going inside this function which has 50 lines.
I have choice of making 30 functions or writing 50 lines, so more than not I pick 50 lines.

But 12 lines comments are draining.

I collapse them, is there a way to collapse all multiline comments by pressing shortcut.

Also another plus would be to hold key like (Ctrl/Cmd) and hovering over multiline comment would show icon, when I click it it'd toggle between collapsed and expanded state. That'd be too cool

I know i can manually collapse them by pressing - sign on the left

data.title: Syntax highlighting for JSX not working for React-Native (when JavaScript Atom Grammar is installed)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: V 1.16.1
- OS Version: Win 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open React-Native project in VS Code
2. Type JSX

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

I just ran `code --disable-extensions` and my colours came back. I found the extension that was causing it: JavaScript Atom Grammar: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.js-atom-grammar

Here is a screenshot of a few minutes ago before it was working; only the <Text> primitive works.

![vscode1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17655219/31135801-fc662cec-a81a-11e7-92de-9e0135c63666.png)

Therefore, this issue is now simply an alert to let you know that this is real and probably happens to others. I am happy to send any other specs as requested.

Here are my user settings:

```
{
    "atomKeymap.promptV3Features": true,
    "editor.multiCursorModifier": "ctrlCmd",
    "editor.formatOnPaste": true,
    "editor.snippetSuggestions": "top",
    "editor.tabSize": 4,
    "emmet.includeLanguages": {
        "javascript": "javascriptreact"
    },
    "files.associations": {
        "*.js": "javascriptreact"
    },
    "git.enableSmartCommit": true,
    "workbench.iconTheme": "material-icon-theme",
    "workbench.startupEditor": "newUntitledFile"
}
```

I'm pretty sure that extension was sprinkling syntax highlighting issues elsewhere in my experience also. I highly recommend taking a look at it with respect to its propensity to create such issues. Thanks!

data.title: Fix small typo
VS Code "and still" won't open in a Linux xrdp session
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->
I still can't believe that twice this issue has been closed without any resolution:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12233
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/27369 

In my own opinion, this still an open issue!

So, if a Windows Admin decide to remote connect to a Linux box, so they can't use VS Code. 

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Setup *xrdp:
```
sudo apt-get install tightvncserver
sudo apt-get install xrdp
sudo apt-get install xubuntu-desktop
echo "xfce4-session" > ~/.xsession
sudo gedit ~/.xsession
sudo service xrdp restart
```
*note: It's known that xrdp works only on 2D desktops, so either MATE and xubuntu need to be installed.

2. From Windows use RDP app to connect to Linux.

3. Open Code, but won't open and there are no errors displayed.

Workaround:
This time around I resolved the issue by narrowing the following Hack in two steps:

1. Copy the system file 'libxcb.so.1.1.0' to the VS Code Insider folder:
```
copy /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libxcb.so.1.1.0 /usr/share/code-insider
```
2. Last execute the sed stream editor command to alter value:
```
sudo sed -i 's/BIG-REQUESTS/_IG-REQUESTS/' /usr/share/code-insider/libxcb.so.1.1.0
```
After these step were completed, I was able to open VS Code Insider on a xrdp session.
must important I didn't have to alter the system file "libxcb.so.1.1.0" as in previous posts was done in the "/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/" location.

(Below image shows implemented hack)
![xrpd_vscode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/31132367-9bc62c56-a82a-11e7-94cb-16a3db125d2b.png)


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Test: debug focus actions
data.body:
- [ ] any os

Refs: #35153
Complexity: 1

We have new actions to focus different debug views. Make sure you can find these actions in the command pallete and that they work as expected.

data.title: Make WorkbenchActionRegistry just a forwarder
data.body: The goal about this is to remove `IWorkbenchActionRegistry` because we have commands, keybindings, and menu registries which are more flexible. However, there is weird code in places which needs to be checked first. At the end duplications like https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/35528/files#diff-b90278b8812101a32d844114fa0dc752L501 shouldn't be in our code anymore.

data.title: macOS High Sierra: parts of the UI not rendering
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.16.1 - OS Version: macOS High Sierra 10.13 Steps to Reproduce: Interface crashes when I open a file in the project folder tree. Reproduces without extensions: Not Tested

data.title: Justify assign-util in presence of object spread and mixin
data.body: We have (and had before) `objects#mixin` and have since while object spread supported by TypeScript. That makes we wonder why we have `objects#assign` which for once duplicates what TypeScript now offers and (I believe) also duplicates what `mixin` offers. We should first try to nuke our `assign` and then also review `mixin`

data.title: Review your deepClone usages
data.body: For reasons unknown to the history books there is `clone` and `deepClone` in [objects.ts](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/objects.ts#L10). Both are a deep clone but both are slightly different. Since there more (53 vs 32) usages of `clone` I am asking you to review/update your references to use `clone` instead of `deepClone`. We should delete the latter at the end of this.

data.title: Does `product.json` slow down startup?
data.body:
1. build vs code locally via `npm run gulp vscode-darwin`
2. start/restart (not reload) it a few times and keep note of the `"[renderer] window.loadUrl() => begin to require(workbench.main.js)"`. On my machine this is around ~390ms
3. copy the `product.json` file from Insiders to your build
4. release step 2, and note that the times for `"[renderer] window.loadUrl() => begin to require(workbench.main.js)"` got worst, on my machine ~450ms

~~"Wer misst, misst Mist" but I believe this is the `extensionsGallery` entry because (a) I imagine it being used on the main side (maybe too early) and (b) because removing that (and keeping everything) changes the times again.~~

data.title: Focus terminal actions are spamming the command pallete
data.body:
There are too many focus terminal actions in the command palette. This way then an accessibility user is searching for focus actions he can not find the appropraite one due to all the clutter imho

Could we somehow reduce this number, by having a focus active one, focus previous, next?

![screen shot 2017-10-03 at 12 37 59](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/31121254-be818c4c-a837-11e7-9d19-096ab3663116.png)

data.title: Color picker replaces wrong range when in template mode
data.body:
1.17-insiders

- open the settings file and add 
```
"workbench.colorCustomizations": {

}
```
- inside the block, use code completion, pick a color
- without changing the cursor location enter a color value, e.g. '#FF0000'
- move the mouse over the color value and pick a new color with the picker
- the result is
```
"welcomePage.buttonHoverBackground": ""#cf6161""
```

data.title: Text selection in Command Palette not working correclty
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.15.1 (41abd21afdf7424c89319ee7cb0445cc6f376959, 2017-08-16T17:15:57.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 17.0.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
gitignore|cod|0.5.0
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.8
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
sublime-keybindings|ms-|2.9.1
jenkinsfile-support|sec|0.1.0
vscode-fileutils|sle|2.6.2

(1 theme extension excluded)


---

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open the command palette `P`
2. Type text and select it to the end of the line **OR** execute a command that will result in selected text in the command palette e.g. `File: Move`
3. Hit the `` (right arrow) key

**Behavior:** Nothing happens.

**Expected Behavior:** The selected text should be unselected and the cursor should move to the end of the line.

**Important:**
* This bug only occurs when the selection spans to the end of the line. 
* This bug does **NOT** occur for hitting the  `` (left arrow) key

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: `Yes`

data.title: ES6 Promise leaks into base/common
data.body:
We have `es6-promise` typings which means everywhere in our codebase the es6 promise is available. In a few places this has now spread... We have two options

* go backwards and use WinJS.Promise everywhere
* go forwards and add a polyfil for the native Promise

data.title: Allow input in the Output console

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hey,
the `debugConsole` is pretty neat and handy. But would it be possible to also add the input functionality to it? Right now, console applications have to be executed in an external console in order for them to receive any input and it's causing a lot of confusion among the users of [Python](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36688454/reading-input-during-debugging-in-python-with-vscode), [C#](https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode/issues/1053), [C++](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cpptools/issues/250) etc.

data.title: RemoteFileService.resolveFiles can return results out of order
data.body:
This can lead to bad bugs in the explorer viewlet where roots become un-expandable. The easiest way to reproduce is add more than 10 folders to the workspace.

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/8414d5c03e059ec6d0f725c74a94315403284f3c/src/vs/workbench/services/files/electron-browser/remoteFileService.ts#L174-L187

This can happen in two cases:
1. There are more than 10 files to resolve.
2. There is a mix of schemes.

For (1) it is because the implementation uses groupBy, which in turn uses sort. node's sort is not stable. However, for small values it is which is why this probably hasn't been noticed before. For (2) its because at the end of the function we just flatten the groups, without respect to the initial input order. This likely hasn't been noticed since most people just have `file` schemes as the roots.

cc @jrieken

data.title: Cannot connect to runtime; make sure that runtime is in 'legacy' debug mode.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: arch linux 

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Debug with "Attach by Process ID"
2.my `launch.json` is 

```
{
  // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible Node.js debug attributes.
  // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes.
  // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [

    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "attach",
      "name": "Attach by Process ID",
      "processId": "${command:PickProcess}",
      "port": 5858
    },
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Launch Program",
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js"
    }
  ]
}
```

and if I remove `"port": 5858` in Attach by Process ID config, no error show, also no work too.

and if remove `processId` in Attach by Process ID config, the error will change to 

```
Ensure Node was launched with --inspect. Cannot connect to runtime process, timeout after 10000 ms - (reason: Cannot connect to the target: connect ECONNREFUSE
```

and I found debug info is weird, specify for `Debugger listening` like:

```
Debugging with inspector protocol because Node.js v8.5.0 was detected.
node --inspect=22688 --debug-brk app.js 
Debugger listening on ws://127.0.0.1:22688/48b3f08a-38bc-49d9-b562-74108735dda4
Debugger attached.
Koa is listening in 4155
```


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: VS Code Crashing

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
VSCode has been crashing since last update. I'm using the latest version (1.16)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6330131/31105664-72b1768e-a818-11e7-9f5e-1704832c9302.png)

data.title: "Heap out of memory" error when running "gulp vscode-darwin-min"
data.body:
Due to the on-going issues preventing new Insiders builds from going out, I tried following the [instructions](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#packaging) and building VS Code from source myself. Unfortunately, I'm running in a error:

```
[01:49:33] Starting 'minify-vscode'...

<--- Last few GCs --->

[59852:0x104801800]   568386 ms: Mark-sweep 1411.7 (1616.3) -> 1411.7 (1616.3) MB, 3590.9 / 0.0 ms  allocation failure GC in old space requested
[59852:0x104801800]   571776 ms: Mark-sweep 1411.7 (1616.3) -> 1411.7 (1594.3) MB, 3389.0 / 0.0 ms  last resort
[59852:0x104801800]   575183 ms: Mark-sweep 1411.7 (1594.3) -> 1411.6 (1594.3) MB, 3406.3 / 0.0 ms  last resort


<--- JS stacktrace --->

==== JS stack trace =========================================

Security context: 0x31dd8efa8799 <JSObject>
    0: builtin exit frame: stringify(this=0x31dd8ef89779 <JSON map = 0x1a39db202ca9>,0x16a626d02311 <undefined>,0x16a626d02311 <undefined>,0x33f144922011 <Object map = 0x1abe0dd6fe91>)

    1: arguments adaptor frame: 1->3
    3: toString [0x16a626d02311 <undefined>:12247] [bytecode=0x1c50de9bd699 offset=28](this=0x24aeb9d2f3c9 <Object map = 0x3228916b2b91>)
    5: minify [0x16a626d02311 <undefi...

FATAL ERROR: CALL_AND_RETRY_LAST Allocation failed - JavaScript heap out of memory
 1: node::Abort() [/usr/local/bin/node]
 2: node::FatalException(v8::Isolate*, v8::Local<v8::Value>, v8::Local<v8::Message>) [/usr/local/bin/node]
 3: v8::Utils::ReportOOMFailure(char const*, bool) [/usr/local/bin/node]
 4: v8::internal::V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(char const*, bool) [/usr/local/bin/node]
 5: v8::internal::Factory::NewRawOneByteString(int, v8::internal::PretenureFlag) [/usr/local/bin/node]
 6: v8::internal::String::SlowFlatten(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::ConsString>, v8::internal::PretenureFlag) [/usr/local/bin/node]
 7: v8::internal::JsonStringifier::SerializeString(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::String>) [/usr/local/bin/node]
 8: v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_<true>(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, bool, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) [/usr/local/bin/node]
 9: v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Result v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Serialize_<false>(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, bool, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) [/usr/local/bin/node]
10: v8::internal::JsonStringifier::Stringify(v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::Object>) [/usr/local/bin/node]
11: v8::internal::Builtin_Impl_JsonStringify(v8::internal::BuiltinArguments, v8::internal::Isolate*) [/usr/local/bin/node]
12: 0x2437c188449d
13: 0x2437c1885d7b
14: 0x2437c1979f5c
[1]    59852 abort      gulp vscode-darwin-min
```

My Node version is `8.6.0` and NPM `3.10.10`. This is on macOS 10.13. Let me know if you have any ideas or need other info!

data.title: [debug] DebugConfigurationProvider.resolveDebugConfiguration does not get invoked on for the first debug session.
data.body:
VSCode Version: 1.17.0-insider, date: 2017-09-29T20:32:46.808Z

Even though my debug extension registers a `DebugConfigurationProvider` upon activation (and it *does* activate on `onDebug:<myExtensionType>` - I can see this under extension debugger), VSCode does not invoke the `resolveDebugConfiguration` method, but instead goes straight to command specified in package.json's `adapterExecutableCommand`.  If the latter isn't provided it just says "Cannot determine executable for debug adapter '{0}'.".

This happens for the first debug session only; for the second one everything works as advertised.

data.title: [folding] Endregion case-sensitive depending on case Region is specified in

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (7ac1f1e05baad03d4dd8f8515f1e598180b2c97e, 2017-09-30T05:06:21.234Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.3

The endregion keyword must be specified in lower case when region is specified in lower case. Endregion is not case sensitive when region is specified in proper, mixed, or upper case. For more details see: http://mikefrobbins.com/2017/10/02/regions-are-now-available-in-vscode-as-of-insiders-build-version-1-17-0/

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Specify region in lower case.
2. Specify endregion in anything other than lower case.

data.title: Improve Windows support in integrated terminal October 2017
data.body:
This is a plan item for terminal work in the October iteration, in rough order of priority:

- [x] Terminal leaks processes https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26807
- [x] Trashcan button kills entire terminal process tree including non-console apps https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/35492
- [ ] Wrapped lines lead to wrong problems https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/32042
- [ ] Vertical glitch in terminal (insiders / Windows) 
 https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/34639
- [ ] Scrolling via mousewheel in the terminal scrolls by a lot on Windows (~12 lines) https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/35111
- [ ] Terminals launched with invalid paths hang during creation and never emit onExit https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/31301

data.title: showErrorMessage(message, ...items) not displayed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When using the showErrorMessage(message, ...items) API, no message is shown. I couldn't find anything about this at all.

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.18.0-insider (f31c369c3bd686d494cb0f01a4ed051b5e9956d0, 2017-10-02T05:16:04.623Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-35-generic

Steps to Reproduce:

1. From an extension do for example `showErrorMessage('message', 'item').then(s=>{})`. No message box is shown.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes
